channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024110236
item.description:
Report E-2024110236

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:17 PM ET, XKC contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer located at a customer's location, Par Electric, at 2101 Manchester Trafficway, Kansas City, MO. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid, which released from 1 or more 1-gallon plastic jug due to other freight crushing the box containing the jugs during transit, impacting the box and the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup from 1-gallon plastic jog of Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid product released to 1â€™x1' area of the trailer floor and cardboard due to improper loading / load shift. The contractors overpacked the product to (1) 5-gallon metal drum and neutralized debris, cardboard, absorbents and PPE to (1) 35-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110441
item.description:
Report X-2024110441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF ON THE PD 11. THE PICKOFF STOPPED THE BELT, LOCKED IT, TESTED IT, LEFT THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON THE INNER 5 GALLON PLASIC CONTAINER HAD A SMALL PERFORATION IN THE CENTER THAT HAD ALLOWED 4 OUNCES OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OUTER CONTAINER.
